meanings.definition: To regard or treat as having little or no value.
meanings.sent1: She would often disvalue her old toys, thinking they were no longer important.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to disvalue someone's efforts just because they are different from yours.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully disvalued the broken toy, pretending it was a treasure map instead.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism seemed to disvalue everything she held dear, like a dark cloud over her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's words of encouragement helped to disvalue the negative thoughts in her mind.

meanings.definition: A lack of value or worth.
meanings.sent1: The disvalue of the old vase was evident when no one wanted to bid on it at the auction.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of disvalue in the antique store, surrounded by items no one seemed to want.
meanings.sent3: The disvalue of the rusty keychain suddenly turned into a funny story when it accidentally unlocked a mysterious door.
meanings.sent4: The disvalue of his words hit her like a ton of bricks, making her question her self-worth.
meanings.sent5: The disvalue of the dusty book was transformed into a hidden gem once she discovered a heartfelt note inside.
